contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox nobility |name=Zofia Ostrogska | image = POL COA Ostrogski.svg|200px | caption = [[Ostrogski coat of arms]]. | house-type = Szlachta | noble family = [[Ostrogski]] | father = [[Aleksander Ostrogski]] | mother = [[Anna Kostka (1575–1635)|Anna Kostka]] | spouse = [[Stanisław Lubomirski (1583–1649)|Stanisław Lubomirski]] | spouse-type = Consort | issue =[[Aleksander Michal Lubomirski|Aleksander Michał Lubomirski]]<br /> [[Jerzy Sebastian Lubomirski]]<br /> [[Konstanty Jacek Lubomirski]]<br /> [[Konstancja Lubomirska]]<br /> [[Anna Krystyna Lubomirska (d. 1667)|Anna Krystyna Lubomirska]] | birth_date = 1595 | birth_place = | death_date = 1622 | death_place = |title = Princess |full name = }} Princess '''Zofia Ostrogska''' ({{lang-lt|Zofija Ostrogiškaitė}}) (1595–1622) was a [[Polish-Lithuanian commonwealth|Polish-Lithuanian]] [[Szlachcianka|noble lady]] of [[Ruthenians|Ruthenian]] origin. She was the wealthiest lady in Poland. She married [[Stanisław Lubomirski (1583–1649)|Stanisław Lubomirski]] in 1613.<ref name="dicart">{{cite book | title=The Dictionary of Art| url=http://books.google.com/books?id=zLYYAAAAIAAJ&q=%22Zofia+Ostrogska%22&dq=%22Zofia+Ostrogska%22&ei=26djSLW2OYPcswPs9PXQBQ&client=firefox-a&pgis=1| last=Turner| first=Jane| year=1996| publisher=Grove| id=isbn=1884446000| page=751}}</ref> Through this marriage he became an owner of 18 towns, 313 villages and 163 granges in the provinces of Kraków, Sandomierz, Ruthenia and Volhynia. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Ostrogska, Zofia | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1595 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1622 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ostrogska, Zofia}} [[Category:1595 births]] [[Category:1622 deaths]] [[Category:Polish nobility|Ostrogski, Zofia]] [[Category:Ostrogski family|Zofia Ostrogska]] {{Poland-noble-stub}} {{Lithuania-noble-stub}}
